title: UN Sustainability Development Goals
summary: The United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are a universal call to action to end poverty, protect the planet, and ensure peace and prosperity for all by 2030. Adopted in 2015 by all UN member states, the 17 goals are part of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, providing a blueprint for addressing the world's most pressing challenges. The SDGs are interconnected, balancing economic growth, social inclusion, and environmental sustainability. They aim to create a fairer, more sustainable world by promoting inclusive development, reducing inequalities, and tackling issues like climate change and environmental degradation, ensuring that no one is left behind.
